metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5967 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
The time subsystem in the Linux kernel through 4.9.9, when CONFIG_TIMER_STATS is enabled, allows local users to discover real PID values (as distinguished from PID values inside a PID namespace) by reading the /proc/timer_list file, related to the print_timer function in kernel/time/timer_list.c and the __timer_stats_timer_set_start_info function in kernel/time/timer.c. It was discovered that the timer stats implementation in the Linux kernel allowed the discovery of a real PID value while inside a PID namespace. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5967` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-aws - 4.4.0-1090.94
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1

linux-image-4.4.0-208-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-208-lowlatency - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1023-azure - 4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-208-generic - 4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.94').
linux-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-lts-utopic: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was ignored').
linux-lts-vivid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-lts-wily: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was ignored').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1').
linux-maguro: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.

linux-signed: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'was needed ESM criteria').
linux-signed-azure package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1023.24~14.04.1').
linux-signed-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-208.240~14.04.1').
